jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

522AAAA68624471B9B05D9DEC886E11E.description:
Find on a map the locations of
Biblical events.

7EF2EFE1906D45198515761CDB214083.description:
Analyze a graph or chart
containing data that shows
changes in aspects of the
physical environment over time.

26EF09153C4149129373177494A43D42.description:
Tell why the knowledge of
geography is necessary to
understanding of history of
people in a place or region.

D730F0A017454D70A3DE825FFF9FED7D.description:
Identify major crops that
sustained people in U.S. or
world.

E3E99E7596354EA184CBDB7EB6AF1BB3.description:
Tell how people, goods, and
services moved from one place
or geographic region to another
in the past.

65E2ABBEC1514BC8B49E19D158B51CF0.description:
Understand Illinois, United States, and world environmental history (United States/World). Understand how Church belief regarding creation and God’s providence shape history of United States and the world. Demonstrate a general understanding of the “story” of humanity from creation to present through a Catholic concept of the world and man.
CSGS1
Relate how history begins and ends in God and how history has a religious dimension. CSIS1

78C72C5C7EC0421BA4D868BB2D21C720.description:
Describe important people,
events, and organizations that
influenced social history.

756368BC6E314850B6DAAB0269FDA501.description:
Compare religious practices
of the past with those of
today.

BAC954FD4205409FB41D48E0A39CEB4B.description:
Compare traditions and
cultures of the past with those
of the present.

92251CEF58E04F6AB554A7C1E1BDB9A5.description:
Tell about the origin of a
family or community tradition
or custom.

1AC318BD74354739A97303ED720D29D8.description:
Compare family life of the
past with family life today.

87546D272952482BA62C1CA4870FD14C.description:
Understand Illinois, United States, and world social history (United States/World). Understand social history of Church, Illinois, United States, and world. Demonstrate an understanding about great figures of history by examining their lives for examples of virtue. CSGS2
Value the significance and impact of the Catholic Church throughout history. CSDS5

DCBBBDFC943747F4BA74118C5C284211.description:
Explain how the changes in
the ways people made a living
have influence modern
society.

8EC1EC6AE4C84B48B4FD08CEFB5E4743.description:
Talk about choices people
made in the past that were
based on religion.

167DE33D5C264E6DACF0381771A83DD2.description:
Describe how changes in the
economic choices in the past
affected a society and its
environment and political life.

1E18AE642F1344BDB5FCD7219D8F4803.description:
Compare how people in a
specific place or region in an
earlier period made a living
with how people make a
living today.

A325D937629545BEB46C6D15B775673D.description:
Understand the development of economic systems (United States/World). Understand how moral or religious thought contributed to the development of economic systems. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7
Discuss how history can assist man in the acquisition of values and virtues. CSIS12

BADB04086F0F4C348A9450266240050B.description:
Tell how past people and
events influence life today.

7093B2E2117A4294AC7BDE279469C76A.description:
Describe key events in the life
of saints and religious leaders
from the past.

02999BF9AB154D289030E0DC67D0D32B.description:
Describe key events in the life
of a significant political figure
or group from the past.

8718A29D55E747CE82280C75C5E91CF3.description:
Place significant religious
events on a timeline.

66C40821A01E411DAE98F28330BA5725.description:
Arrange a series of events in
U.S. and/or world history in
chronological order.

B67A6DC74D49494FAEE944F5DBA01E9D.description:
Understand the development of significant political events (United States/World). Understand the development of significant Church or religious events. Explain the history of the Catholic Church and its impact in human events. CSIS4
Exhibit knowledge of essential dates, persons, places and facts, especially those relevant to the western traditions. CSIS

B1D9CBC2DA90407BB917B015A89945E6.description:
Tell why the location of
where an event occurred helps
to explain why and how it
happened.

1DA5894C4F084BE9A1D35AE93D916960.description:
List places to look for sources
of information about the past.

B52C4589FFC14732B046C342765D3842.description:
Draw a general conclusion
about life during a specific
period in a specific region or
place using a combination of
historical sources (e.g.,
images, artifacts, texts
including a Bible).

93CA2864B79B4D8C84126313D8784675.description:
List the important details
contained in an image of life
in the past.

ED0716255B384A70BEC908C987F5318D.description:
Construct a timeline for a
given period and place a
series of events at their proper
location on timeline,
incorporate Catholic history.

8D507ACE3E4B44FA862D88BE3A501C41.description:
Apply the skills of historical analysis and interpretation. Apply the skills of historical analysis and interpretation to religious events, trends and Church individuals and movements. Relate that Jesus, as God incarnate, existed in history just like we do. CSIS2
Describe how reading history is a way we can learn about what God does for humanity. CSIS3

C988653F1C0D444BA33063C61CD9D8C5.description: Understand events, trends, individuals and movements shaping the history of Illinois, the United States and other Nations. Understand religious events, trends, individuals and movements shaping the history of the United States, other Nations and the Church.
